name: Hotel Haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for the weekend in February, spacious room, big bathroom, very elegant lobby bar and sitting areas - chess, fireplace, huge leather sofas etc. Very friendly and competent staff. Very centrally located, walking distance everywhere. nice breakfast (with even finnish sparkling whitecurrant wine :)
reviews.title: Very elegant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent fish restaurant - allegedely best in town. It being February, we had a great deal on the price. Only downside i can think of - 22 euros for a sandwich in the lobby bar seems a bit too elegant. Oh, there's also a spa, but we haven't tried it.
reviews.title: Little luxuries but poor breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. We stayed here only one night though. Hotel entrance was very inviting especially when it was dark in January and freezing cold outside. The interior of the hotel is chic, warm and comfy. Location is perfect, near all the sights and centre.
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Comfort room was big and decoration the best we have experienced in Finland (haven’t tried the Kämp hotel though so cannot compare to that). Small luxuries make the stay, B&O television, another TV inside the bathroom, plenty of channel choices, comfy bed, Elemis amenities. They also have a good selection of drinks and snacks in the minibar but the prices are quite steep (even for a 5 star hotel). Internet was included to the room price which is always a plus. I also liked the fact that they had additional amenity kit in the closet. Even though you have to pay extra for that it’s nice to have it ready in the room in case e.g. your luggage gets lost/arrives late so that you don’t have to run around the city trying to collect all the necessities.
reviews.title: Not a proper value for Small Luxury Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn’t dine in the restaurants during our stay but I have dined at Havis restaurant before. Excellent food but pricey. They also have a terrace in the inner yard which is probably very nice during summer time. Unfortunately it was so cold during our stay that there was no chance of enjoying that. The breakfast was served in Havis and I have to admit I was very disappointed. The quality of the food was definitely good but the selection was very limited. You even had to pay extra for eggs etc.
reviews.title: A great luxury hotel in an excellent location

reviews.text: Very helpful staff, clean and spacious room and bathroom, classy lobby and chic breakfast area but poor breakfast for sure. It was comfortable staying at Haven.
reviews.title: loved the staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the hotel Haven was otherwise quite nice - room was very nice and clean, lobby and bar areas cozy and stylish, service considerate yet a little reserved as so many times in Finland. We were quite satisfied with our stay until we went for the breakfast in the morning. We were quite astonished by the limited selection of things you're used to find even in much less pricey hotels in Scandinavia - and here we are sitting in one, that claims to be "a gourmet’s treat" in their web site and brochures. The worst part of it was, that they actually charge extra for eggs and other warm stuff. They say it's because they want to guarantee they are fresh for each client. That's nice. But in other hotels of this standard they do the same, with no extra cost - breakfast IS normally included in the room price in Finland and other nordic countries unlike in for example U.S.
reviews.title: If you value a nice breakfast, go elsewhere

reviews.text: But the worst happend after we'd been there for a while. Another customer dropped a whole cup of coffee on the floor, but no-one ever came to clean it up! The personnel walked right through the puddle of coffee, but never did anything about it. We had to walk right through it as well when filling our plates, but they did not pay any attention. When we politely asked wheter they were going to, they just said something about having to possibly mop it away.
reviews.title: Great Place to be, quite "Havenly"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I wanted to give feedback, the hotel manager seemed to take my complains seriously (after I first got an e-mail address from the reception that went to whole another company), but when the restaurant manager later called me he did not sound like taking our feedback seriously at all. Which means, the breakfast is pretty sure going to be the same in the future. Make no mistake - all the incredients were of perfect quality. It was just really really modest with for example tiny rolls and croissants, a cup of 1/2 strawberry, two blueberries, two rasberries and 4 red currants, standard yoghurt, very modest selection of cereals etc. A disappointment for us, who do value a nice breakfast.
reviews.title: Very pleasant hotel with excellent service

reviews.text: This was my second stay at the hotel, the first time in October 2009. What a great, boutique hotel. Right off the historic waterfront with great restaurants nearby. A warm cozy place, luxurious rooms and very friendly staff.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: I stayed here for one week. It's a great bang for your buck, I'd say.
reviews.title: Calm and elegant room with great service

reviews.text: The room isn't huge, but it's very well appointed, comfortable bed and great bathroom. There was an annoying incence but I just closed the lid on the bottle.
reviews.title: Can't fault the Haven after many stays

reviews.text: Location is great on the harbour,walking distance everywhere, both restaurants in the hotel are top class. Usually I wouldn't dine in a hotel restaurant but here it's not a stupid rip-off but a cozy pleasant experience with great food. Gym is small but fine. At breakfast I didn't miss the big buffet of smoked salmon and herring with bacon fat and sausages all mixed together. There was just everything you needed and it was of fine quality.
reviews.title: Cental Location, Good Rooms, Nice Dinner but Breakfast starts at 0700 and not a minute earlier !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at Hotel Glo before but prefer Haven better because in my experience it was less 'trendy' and more private.
reviews.title: Amazing room, poor breakfast

reviews.text: A colleague had a room in 4th floor and during the Saturday night he had trouble sleeping due to nightclub noise downstairs, but I was fine on 7th floor. I suppose in this hotel it's worth asking for a view (which I didn't have) , it would be very beautiful looking out to the frozen see.
reviews.title: A haven for the weary traveler
Hotel Haven? What about Hotel Heaven!
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to HEL. I believe there are only 5 5-star hotel in the city: 3 Hiltons, Hotel Kamp and Hotel Haven. I haven't stayed at the other 4, but I would still highly recommend this hotel. But remember to book in advance since they have only 77 rooms, it gets filled up really quickly.

reviews.title: Fabulous hotel. Great location.
reviews.text: Pros

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Very modern decor (but most importantly, a very warm tone throughout the hotel's and room design, lots of light colors, wood, white etc..)
reviews.title: so immaculate, so perfect, so expensive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Very comfortable beds
reviews.title: Pricey, but fantastic location!

reviews.text: - Bathroom amenities all "Elemis" branded
reviews.title: Very central hotel : a great room with a great view on the Port

description: Hotel Haven, Finland’s first member of the Small Luxury Hotels of the World chain, is designed to provide homely warmth, exclusive comfort and high-quality services for the discerning guest. The hotel with 77 individual and well-appointed rooms and premium restaurant and conference services is conveniently situated in the attractive setting of Helsinki’s Market Square.In the elegant yet cosy foyer, guests can relax by the fireplace and browse leisurely through the daily papers.
